intro: Diceratella inermis, commonly known as the naked horned grass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a smooth surface and a fibrous texture. Diceratella inermis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
